title: Full of Liars
text: This is the worst job board app or website I‚Äôve seen. It is full of job postings that are full of lies are misinformation, and LinkedIn has zero interest in holding these companies accountable. It is very common to see a job posting with the label of ‚Äúentry level‚Äù but the company then goes on to say, but actually you need 2+ years prior experience, which is 2+ years away from being an entry level job. Or a job that says in the title $30-$35 an hour. But then in the description the company says you can make ‚Äúup to $20 an hour‚Äù. Not only does this app not have a way to report these, they ignore your email when you take the extra time to tell them about it. Thus, it odd evident that they don‚Äôt care what the companies say on their job postings, as long as the sheep keep using the app.

title: Scrolling issues
text: Numerous issues with freezing when trying to scroll, particularly in the jobs tab. Please fix

title: Please remove the ‚Äòcatch up‚Äô tab from my network
text: The new catch up tab in my network is a very noisy update and completely ruins the importance of the My Network tab. I‚Äôve contacted support but I received no reply. Please remove the catch up tab

title: 347ZARLINO
text: At gmail dot com

title: API calls make UI stall
text: EDIT: v9.1.343 is still wildly broken. Now touch events often stop working when you scroll on the main feed. If you scroll past something, stop and scroll back you‚Äôll end up scrolling past it up then down, then up, then down, then up ‚Äî you will not be able to stop the scroll on the post you want to see unless you set your phone down an take a deep breath in between each scroll. This app was QA‚Äôed by a donut. Extremely buggy on iOS on iPhone 12 max. I‚Äôve deleted the app and reinstalled. There‚Äôs some very badly managed API calls that feel like it‚Äôs using jQuery instead of a modern MVC framework causing every other scroll to click instead. I don‚Äôt understand why it became so much worse, or how QA engineers let this out the door. It‚Äôs very badly managed developers and software. This was not an issue at all a couple years ago, shortly after Microsoft bought LinkedIn. It is however unsurprising that the UI became much worse after MS got involved and MS has no design cycle nor do they have a QA cycle so it‚Äôs absolutely likely the UI will continue to get worse. Sigh, hopefully I‚Äôll land a job so I don‚Äôt need to use this broken and frustrating UI much longer. The most frustrating part it I tried to tell LinkedIn and the customer support claimed the couldn‚Äôt replicate, which is funny because I tested on several iPhones. It‚Äôs gaslighting on their part. The whole customer support experience also reminded e of Microsoft, where thy just don‚Äôt believe you and assume the customer is doing something wrong. I don‚Äôt think they want to fix it.

title: No way to alter feed preferences
text: App is riddled with recruiters attempting to be motivational speakers. I honestly feel bad for all of them. If you see one trending topic in your feed, the next 50 posts will be on the same topic, each with a complete stranger trying to one up each other in an attempt to sound intelligent. It is truly cringy. Please fix this so it can be turned off.

title: Charged me full on the pretext of trial offer.
text: Offered me a trial and then charged me full. It‚Äôs $69.99 ‚Ä¶ Seriously, LinkedIn!!! Shame!

text: Tried the premium trial and was blatantly mislead to believe i could ‚Äúlook whos been viewing my profile with premium‚Äù its all blatant lies. Im sick of these data thieves up charging. Linked in will be deleted

title: Broken / Unusable
text:
I upgraded to an iPhone 15 Pro and the app is broken on this phone. It‚Äôs not a problem with my account - it works when I log in on my husband‚Äôs 15 Pro Max, but not on my 15 Pro.

Specifically, the app freezes when I click on my profile photo - I cannot switch to managed profiles, I cannot access my profile, I cannot access my settings. 

I have deleted and reinstalled. I have logged out and logged back in. Please fix the app so I can use it.

title: Incredibly Laggy and App Always Crashes
text: Why is the mobile app becoming super laggy and crashes in the middle of my job applications? Becoming very very infuriating‚Ä¶ why do I pay for LinkedIn premium if this is the case?

title: Confirmed bug with the date filter üëé
text: The LinkedIn support team has confirmed there is a bug that prevents the date filter from working properly on their mobile app. As a result, many job postings will not appear when using a date filter. This means, the app is useless for job searching, but I doubt many people realize this unless they‚Äôre comparing their results to the desktop version. They need to get this resolved quickly.

title: OPEN TO section not letting me update info
text: I kept trying to add different job titles to the OPEN TO section and every time I click on a specific job title & I save it, it goes back to the open to screen and the title isn‚Äôt saved.

title: It constantly crashes!!
text: When I want to take a look at my profile, Suddenly the app crashes.

title: Suggested posts need to be removed.
text: I‚Äôve recently started getting constant unwanted suggested posts that there is no way to remove. It‚Äôs made the app unusable since they are so frequent and useless.

title: Does not seem to be excellent at anything
text: The app functions okay. The main page is completely useless, but that‚Äôs less on the app and more on the algorithm. I really only use the app to search for jobs, and even that isn‚Äôt a smooth experience. The app constantly shows me jobs that I have either reported previously or asked the app not to show me. There are way too many spammed posts, flat-out scams, or jobs explicitly and maliciously placed in an incorrect category. I probably wouldn‚Äôt recommend this app except that it does have a lot of job posts, so if you‚Äôre looking for a job, it might be worth the aggravating experience.

title: Quality lost.
text: I used to use LinkedIn for job searches as it was much more reliable than indeed or zip recruiter as far as scamming goes. That‚Äôs no longer the case. I apply to at least 5 jobs a day. Today alone I‚Äôve received 2 scam interviews. It‚Äôs hard enough to find a decent job these days, and I expect LinkedIn to do a better job filtering these out. Idk what happened but the quality has gone downhill drastically .

title: Not a fan of the new ‚Äúcatch up‚Äù feature.
text: Love the app in so many ways and use it daily. One piece of feedback: The My Network tab still includes new connection requests but now has a ‚Äúcatch up‚Äù feature included. I click on the notification thinking I have a new request and I get a catch up notice about someone‚Äôs birthday. This is not of value to me. Keep My Network for new requests.

title: Only Access by Cellular Data
text: I use LinkedIn regularly for my business.  Until recently I‚Äôve been able to access it both by wifi and cellular data on my phone and iPad. Recently something changed and I cannot access LinkedIn through my wifi on either device.  I have to be on cellular data. I‚Äôve checked with my provider and they say everything is good on their end and my wifi signal is strong. Don‚Äôt understand why all of the sudden I‚Äôm having this problem but it‚Äôs very disheartening.   I‚Äôd love to find an answer to this problem.

title: Good for jobs, very bad at app
text:
Do you like getting a job? You might be forced to get this app then. 

Do you like obvious and simple apps? Do you like apps that don‚Äôt crash or send you 500 spam messages a day? Then maybe this app isn‚Äôt for you. 

LinkedIn is like slightly tainted water, it might save your life but you‚Äôre gonna hate every second using it.

title: Member Fees
text: The monthly subscription is way too expensive and there are no student options for a discount.

title: Great Concept, Terrible App
text: This app is obviously a great idea and is very necessary for all in the business realm, but the app is slow, glitchy, and very frustrating to use.

title: Terrible user experience
text: On iPhone 14 pro. I‚Äôll have app open and be typing a response, get interrupted and unlock my phone later, I‚Äôll see my response disappear and it takes me to my feed. I‚Äôm constantly losing my place in this app! Another example I was just watching a full screen video and had to pause it for a minute to help my kid with something.  When I came back my phone was locked - unlock my phone and my video disappeared and the feed refreshed.  Absolutely terrible user experience.

title: Horrible
text: Horrible app

text: Zack has done an excellent job finding new lessors, helping with options and renewals, etc. for our 15,000 SF Ohio building. we would recommend him highly.

title: Worst app ever

title: Unfriendly
text: I've always disliked this app. It's not the worst, but when it's time to make a singular impression - asking to connect, it just send the invite without the option to compose a nice message. Since first impressions are priceless, it's unacceptable. And then you have to wait 3 weeks after withdrawal, with no advance notice - even worse.

title: Good in some ways bad in others
text:
I‚Äôve been using the LinkedIn app regularly for the last 60 days or so as a job search tool. I‚Äôm not loving how under the jobs section it suggests jobs you‚Äôd be a top applicant for that aren‚Äôt even in the same state as me and they‚Äôre not remote. I‚Äôd rather do my own search and filter those out since it‚Äôs mostly showing me onsite and hybrid openings in other states. Additionally, the folks posting job openings either do not understand what Remote means or the options isn‚Äôt clear because a lot of the jobs that say remote, once you open the descriptions they have it typed out that you must reside in the state the company is in (which means those jobs are Hybrid, not remote and should not be shown to job seekers outside of that state).
I understand the quick option of seeing jobs you‚Äôre a top applicant for or similar to jobs you‚Äôve saved but when you don‚Äôt have the option to filter those it‚Äôs not a good option in my opinion. Additionally, as a paying premium member it‚Äôd be nice to have more in mail credits to use.

title: Worst QA ever!
text: I‚Äôve submitted complaints (several mediums) yet LinkedIn absolutely refuses to fix basic bugs! Job alert search is full of bugs. It‚Äôs also a terrible UX but that‚Äôs beyond the basic compliant of countless bugs. Can‚Äôt disable job alerts or modify them in the app! It‚Äôs been like this for weeks. LinkedIn premium is the biggest waste of money ever! Rating: negative stars

title: Sadly one of the worst IPad experiences out there
text:
This is ridiculous in 2023, frankly.

The interface as you can see above wastes 60% of available space with grey useless sidebars.  The chat interface uses 100% the phone buttons, and even the floating keyboard from Apple covers the send or attachement buttons all the time.   Sending a reply and taping a tiny 16x16 px button that‚Äôs millimeters from the expand button and edge is horrific.    Being unable to enlarge the conversation and fill the interface window is just inexcusable.  Do better. Your users deserve better than this from the top Job site in the industry.

title: App Nearly Unusable
text: App has continuously gotten worse over the last couple years. Latest version is nearly unusable on ios17 iPhone 15 pro max. Freezes crashes totally unresponsive.

title: Captcha doesn‚Äôt work and can‚Äôt log in
text: The captcha makes me repeatedly click on the upright image

title: Lost it‚Äôs real purpose!
text: LinkedIn feels cluttered with ads, news bits, politically motivated posts, and users being spammed relentlessly by useless ‚Äútrainers‚Äù and ‚Äúresume writers.‚Äù Job searches are difficult because promoted jobs are usually irrelevant for the search and sorting by ‚Äúentry level‚Äù is pointless because highly experienced results are coming up by the hundreds! Filter‚Äôs don‚Äôt work because of bad data feeds from external job applicants systems. User cannot message themselves which is a helpful feature when trying to send or house job related files. When searching for a job, it‚Äôs much easier and quicker to use other straight forward job boards.

title: Login issues
text: This is my first time trying to log into the iPadOS version of the LinkedIn app, and I‚Äôm unable to authenticate past the CAPTCHA where you have to verify the correct orientation of the animal (baby rhinoceros?).Every time I click the correct picture of the animal, I get a message saying ‚Äú1 done, Verification complete. You‚Äôve proven you‚Äôre a human. Continue your action.‚Äù, followed by the puzzle resetting and an error code popping up at the top saying ‚ÄúYour noCAPTCHA user response code is missing or invalid.‚Äù This loops forever; hopefully no one else has this issue while trying to login.

title: Newest build, race conditions and make using it impossible
text:
Latest refresh has a lot of problems. Severe lagging typing in messages, scrolling issues, can‚Äôt view all liked in a post.

Lots of bugs shipped in this build.

title: Something is not right with this app
text: This is not an official Apple application

title: Used to be a real community
text: First of all the app is barely functional from a brand standpoint. I can‚Äôt manage much of my business page from here. Plus there‚Äôs the incessant pop ups trying to force me to buy Premium ‚Äî I spend thousands each month on LI ads, maybe stop being greedy dix and leave the $70 a month alone? How many times do I need to say ‚Äúnot interested‚Äù before you get the picture? And don‚Äôt get me started on the culture emerging these last few years. Everyone thinks they‚Äôre Melinda Gates or Brene Brown but the reality is the feed‚Äôs mostly empty, garbage posts made with AI that don‚Äôt add any value at all. It‚Äôs been such a disappointment to see what used to be a vibrant REAL community turn into corporate shilling and soapbox monologues.

title: What a pain
text: I recently updated my LinkedIn for the first time in 10 years. I sent connections to a few people I know. They never received my request and less than 24 hours after I submitted my drivers license to become verified they restricted my account for unusual login activity. Huge pain in the butt. I was about to upgrade to LinkedIn premium but I‚Äôm so afraid of the crap I have to go through, I will never give them a dime.

title: Terrible Moderating System
text: They have completed automated it to the point it‚Äôs ineffective, there is no appeal and no talking to someone real unless you publicly put pressure on them.  LinkedIn has one of the worst moderation systems I‚Äôve ever seen and that‚Äôs saying something.
